t: Psalm 106
Israel’s Rebelliousness and the Lord’s Deliverances.
Praise*pn the Lord!*s Oh*ln give thanks to the Lord,*s for He is good; For*ln His lovingkindness is everlasting.
Who*ln can speak of the mighty deeds of the Lord,*s Or*ln can show forth all His praise?
How*ln blessed are those who keep justice, Who*ln practice righteousness at all times!
Remember*ln me, O Lord,*s in Your*i favor toward Your people; Visit*ln me with Your salvation,
That*ln I may see the prosperity of Your chosen ones, That*ln I may rejoice in the gladness of Your nation, That*ln I may glory with Your inheritance.
We*ln have sinned like our fathers, We*ln have committed iniquity, we have behaved wickedly.
Our*ln fathers in Egypt did not understand Your wonders; They*ln did not remember Your abundant kindnesses, But*ln rebelled by the sea, at the Red Sea.
Nevertheless*ln He saved them for the sake of His name, That*ln He might make His power known.
Thus*ln He rebuked the Red Sea and it dried up, And*ln He led them through the deeps, as through the wilderness.
So*ln He saved them from the hand of the one who hated them,*i And*ln redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
The*ln waters covered their adversaries; Not*ln one of them was left.
Then*ln they believed His words; They*ln sang His praise.
They*ln quickly forgot His works; They*ln did not wait for His counsel,
But*ln craved intensely in the wilderness, And*ln tempted God in the desert.
So*ln He gave them their request, But*ln sent a wasting disease among them.
When*ln they became envious of Moses in the camp, And*ln of Aaron, the holy one of the Lord,*s
The*ln earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, And*ln engulfed the company of Abiram.
And*ln a fire blazed up in their company; The*ln flame consumed the wicked.
They*ln made a calf in Horeb And*ln worshiped a molten image.
Thus*ln they exchanged their glory For*ln the image of an ox that eats grass.
They*ln forgot God their Savior, Who*ln had done great things in Egypt,
Wonders*ln in the land of Ham And*iln awesome things by the Red Sea.
Therefore*ln He said that He would destroy them, Had*ln not Moses His chosen one stood in the breach before Him, To*ln turn away His wrath from destroying them.*i
Then*ln they despised the pleasant land; They*ln did not believe in His word,
But*ln grumbled in their tents; They*ln did not listen to the voice of the Lord.*s
Therefore*ln He swore to them That*ln He would cast them down in the wilderness,
And*ln that He would cast their seed among the nations And*ln scatter them in the lands.
They*ln joined themselves also to Baal-peor, And*ln ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
Thus*ln they provoked Him*i to anger with their deeds, And*ln the plague broke out among them.
Then*ln Phinehas stood up and interposed, And*ln so the plague was stayed.
And*ln it was reckoned to him for righteousness, To*ln all generations forever.
They*ln also provoked Him*i to wrath at the waters of Meribah, So*ln that it went hard with Moses on their account;
Because*ln they were rebellious against His Spirit, He*ln spoke rashly with his lips.
They*ln did not destroy the peoples, As*ln the Lord*s commanded them,
But*ln they mingled with the nations And*ln learned their practices,
And*ln served their idols, Which*ln became a snare to them.
They*ln even sacrificed their sons and their daughters to the demons,
And*ln shed innocent blood, The*ln blood of their sons and their daughters, Whom*ln they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; And*ln the land was polluted with the blood.
Thus*ln they became unclean in their practices, And*ln played the harlot in their deeds.
Therefore*ln the anger of the Lord*s was kindled against His people And*ln He abhorred His inheritance.
Then*ln He gave them into the hand of the nations, And*ln those who hated them ruled over them.
Their*ln enemies also oppressed them, And*ln they were subdued under their power.
Many*ln times He would deliver them; They,*ln however, were rebellious in their counsel, And*ln so*i sank down in their iniquity.
Nevertheless*ln He looked upon their distress When*ln He heard their cry;
And*ln He remembered His covenant for their sake, And*ln relented according to the greatness of His lovingkindness.
He*ln also made them objects*i of compassion In*ln the presence of all their captors.
Save*ln us, O Lord*s our God, And*ln gather us from among the nations, To*ln give thanks to Your holy name And*ln glory in Your praise.
Blessed*ln be the Lord,*s the God of Israel, From*ln everlasting even to everlasting. And*ln let all the people say, “Amen.” Praise*ln the Lord!*s
